intro: Vignea tenuissima, commonly known as the slender morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant has slender, twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. Vignea tenuissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats.
